title: Drawing, "Sketches of Plants and of Part of the  Balustrade Bordering the Terrace at the Inn at Guaranda, Ecuador", June 3, 1857
medium:
Recto:  Graphite, brush and white gouache on cream-colored paper
Verso:  Graphite on cream-colored paper
inscribed:
Recto:  Inscribed in graphite with numbers throughout, and at upper right:  2 yellowish green / very light flowers / 3- brilliant clear / blue inclining / to purple / 4 - leaf like tips / crimson like / flowers; again, at center left:  Jatail [Jatciel ?];again, at center:  These blue flowers grow in a great abundance making / the sides of the hills purple with them; again, at bottom left:  2- Green Porcelain / 3- salmon cream color / originally; again, at bottom right:  Bit of Balustrade in the / Posada at Guaranda Jun 3 57; and vertically at left margin: Presented 1917 / by Mr. LP Church No 207.

Verso:  Inscribed in graphite, at top center:  Chimborazo; again, at top right:  [an arrow] East; and at bottom right:  Road.
description:
Recto:  Vertical sketches of two groups of plants, a few at left more at right are shown at top, while a part of a balustrade bordering a terrace up to which two steps lead, as well as vases and flower tops are visible at the bottom.

Verso:  Horizontal distant view of a mountainous landscape with Mount Chimborazo towering in the left background.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Sketches of Plants and of Part of the  Balustrade Bordering the Terrace at the Inn at Guaranda, Ecuador", June 3, 1857.
June 3, 1857. Recto:  Graphite, brush and white gouache on cream-colored paper
Verso:  Graphite on cream-colored paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-207.
